module_restrictions.College of Business Administration (CBA): Restricted to students who are currently studying business or economics at their home university. Students majoring in Economics should consider other non-Business courses.
module_restrictions.Dept. of Computer Science and Engineerin: Applicants must have earned at least 15 credits in CSE-related courses. Starting from Spring 2020’s admission, CSE has decided to control the number of accepted exchange students on the undergraduate-level, due to a lack of course capacity and placement.
module_restrictions.Korean History/Psychology/Statistics maj: Applicants must provide proof of Korean language proficiency (KLPT Level 5 or above).
module_restrictions.College of Law and School of Dentistry: Not open to undergraduate exchange students.
module_restrictions.Dept. of Vocal Music: Restricted to students who are currently studying vocal music at their home university.

visa_info: Exchange students must apply for a D2 student visa before arrival in Korea. All students are advised to apply for the necessary visa immediately after they receive the official offer letter/email from their host university.
accommodations_info: Exchange students may apply for the Gwanak Residence Halls, but room assignment is not guaranteed. Off-campus housing is available around the campus.
cost_of_living:
The estimated monthly living expenses for exchange students in Seoul National University are as follows:

Accommodation: ₩300,000 - ₩700,000
Food: ₩400,000
Transport: ₩100,000
Academic Expenses: ₩50,000
Others (Entertainment, clothes): ₩300,000

Monthly Estimate: ₩1,150,000 - ₩1,550,000
